of unchosen motherhood” (82).
e.  “There  are  some  undeniable  bad  consequences  of  a  woman’s  being
forced  to  bear  a  child  against  her  will.  First  is  the  trauma  of  going
through a pregnancy and giving birth to a child who is not desired, a
trauma more long-lasting than that experienced by some (only some)
women who experience an early abortion. The grief of giving up a child
at its birth—and at nine months it is a child one has felt m
